text.sentence: Dear Prof Lu,
Hope you are doing great.
I got PhD admission from two universities - U Texas Dallas and Illinois Institute of Technology.
But they didn't mention funding. Right now, I'm waiting for a few more schools to turn up, and also mailing the faculty members for support.
Unfortunately, my political science funding from Prof Burt Monroe has expired - so in Spring, I have no appointment.
I have applied to TLT for an assistantship and also a few other places, but I'm not sure.
Spring is probably the last sem I'll need funding for.
Could you please let me know in case you have support for one semester (tuition+stipend) or if anybody you know has some support?
text.signature: Thank you very much and sincere regards, Chi

text.sentence: Hi Chi,
Great to hear the positive news.
It's still early and I'm sure you'll hear positive news from more universities within the next 2 months.
Unfortunately I do not have any support for next semester.
I hope you will be able to figure something out.
Wish you a productive and fruitful year ahead.
Thank you very much, Prof Lu.
I'll keep you updated on the applications.
Dear Prof Lu,
I got admission from U of North Texas, Florida International University, and U Illinois Chicago, in addition to Illinois Institute of Technology, and U Texas Dallas.
Among these five, I was offered funding from U North Texas (UNT), U Illinois Chicago, and U Texas Dallas.
I'll probably join UNT this fall under Prof Rada Mihalcea.
This spring and summer I got funding from Architectural Engineering department (Prof Richard Mistrick).
This is java programming and debugging of a large software project.
So far I like this work. :)
I'm visiting UNT as a prospective grad student in spring break (March 2 - March 4).
Thank you very much for your kind help, support and appreciation.
I can never repay my debt to you.
I'd need another letter of recommendation from you. :P :)
This is for UNT. The addressees are:
Stephanie Deacon <Stephanie.Deacon@unt.edu>, Bill Buckles <Bill.Buckles@unt.edu>
(UNT Computer Science and Engineering)
They will accept MS Word or PDF letters as email attachment.
The admission decision cannot be finalized before they receive the recos.
Thank you very much again, and wish you a very happy Spring Break.
Dear chi,
Congratulations on your success.
UNT will be a great choice.
I've just sent them a letter.
Thank you very much, Prof Lu.
Dear Dr. Lu,
I thank you for submitting your letter of recommendation for chi.
I will gladly place this in his application packet.
Again, I thank you for your prompt response!
Dear Prof Lu,
I got teaching assistantship at UNT for 2012-2013.
My visit to UNT was also successful, and I talked to Prof Rada Mihalcea on the formality problem.
She was really interested, and said it would be a nice idea to pursue.
Texas is pretty hot in summer, but otherwise fine. Prof Mihalcea said she thought you were my PhD advisor, and she probably met you in a conference/seminar earlier.
Thank you very much for your kind support and wishes.
I'll keep you updated on any news.
Great. I co-organized a workshop at NAACL 2007 in Rochester, and we invited her to give a plenary at the workshop.
She is amazingly productive, and it would be great if you could work with her.
Dear Prof Lu,
I have converted from PhD to Masters, and will graduate with a non-thesis Masters from PSU in summer.
Moving to UNT in August (August 5 starting from SCE - reaching TX Aug 7). I'll be driving to TX - hope that's going to be exciting. :)
I have been offered an additional GATS scholarship by the CSE department at UNT.
This was in addition to the teaching assistantship.
In the meantime, I couldn't yet look into the formality problem and extension to implicature score as we discussed.
I'll probably not be able to do anything on this line before reaching UNT, because in the summer, I'm funded by a professor in Architecture Engineering Department, so I have to work for him.
Once at UNT, I'll try to secure an independent study (3 credits) under Prof Mihalcea.
If it works out, then I'll start discussing with you again on the implicature score.
I have some more ideas from complex network theory that can be applied to this issue, but I need to read more on that.
I took a course last semester in complex networks - it's helping a lot.

Looks like there are many aspects of style (e.g. coherence, cohesion, syntactic variations, etc) that are closely linked with networks of words and their properties - it might be clustering coefficient, betweenness centrality, pagerank or degree distribution of a network.

And also, there is a lot of work along this line to begin with. So I was just wondering if there could be a relation between word networks and implicature as well - I conceived some ideas. But I'll explore more on this after summer.
text.signature: Hope you are doing well, and best regards, chi

text.sentence: Hi chi,
Thanks for the update.
I'm glad to hear that everything is going well, and I'm sure you'll do we at UNT.
I'd also certainly be happy to continue our discussion on style, as your research on that front continues.
I'm spending May and June in China this year, and it has been fun.
Yes, I'm sure the weather is now really awesome there !! :-) :-) :-)
text.signature: Thanks, and have a nice holiday, chi

text.sentence: Dear Prof Lu,
Hope you had a nice holiday in China with your family. :)
Are you back at PSU ?
I was wondering if we could meet and discuss on the implicature score, especially previous work and data.
If you are in State College, could you please give me some time this week ?
Hi chi,
Yes, we had a good vacation in China.
What about this Wednesday either 10:30-11:30am or 1:30-2:30pm?
I will have a meeting from 12-1pm on that day.
Prof Lu, I'll meet you at 1:30 on Wednesday.
Dear Prof Lu,
I have arrived at UNT, and now kind of settled.
Here it's really hot in the noon, but gets cooler during afternoon and evening.
The 1300-mile drive from PA to TX was amazing too. :) :)
Fortunately, my car didn't go wrong. :) :)
I'll always remember this trip :)
It's like you start with the mountains in PA and WV - cross the wild, wild WV - to enter rolling meadows of KY and TN, and then cross the Mississippi to AR.
I think I also crossed Tennessee river somewhere in TN, and Arkansas river near Little Rock, AR. It was truly amazing :)
Here I talked to Rada. She is great :) :)
I had a very productive meeting with her.
She also invited me to a dinner party in honor of one of her students graduating and getting a job.
There I met most of her students and their family, plus two faculty members and their family.
We spent a nice evening there.
Regarding research, Rada is flexible but she'd rather want me work on authorship attribution using complex networks.
So I did not start anything on the Implicature and Formality scoring yet.
I'm looking for some undergrad students here (or in my college in India) so that they can help me out on the formality problem and I can concentrate more on the problem with Rada.
I'll keep you informed on this.
I'm a TA for this year, and will be taking three courses in Fall, as follows:
NLP (under a new faculty, Rodney Nielsen (he's from UColorado Boulder))
Rada's NLP Seminar
Game Design (under Prof Ian Parberry) - I wanted to take this course because I have a plan on designing a game on getting labeled text data
I'll still have to figure out who to approach for inviting a guest speaker.
I'd really like you to visit here :) :)
I like TX much more than PA.
It might be hot, but it's very beautiful and vibrant :) :)
Hope you are doing well with your family. :)
Hi chi,
Great to hear that you had an exciting and safe trip and that you like it down there.
I'm sure you'll do well.

I'm not sure I have something interesting enough for a CSE audience at the moment, so don't worry about that for a while. The fall semester will be a busy semester for me, but hopefully I'll survive everything.
ok, I'll keep you posted.
